pr_title: [JENKINS-57828] Cleaning up the Snippet Generator output for PodTemplateStep

timeline.message:
[CPLT2-6206][JENKINS-57828] Cleaning up the Snippet Generator output for PodTemplateStep.
Followed the instructions https://jenkins.io/doc/developer/plugin-development/pipeline-integration/ in the Handling default values section, except had to use `Util.fixEmpty(String s)` instead of `Util.fixNull()`
Changed the default value of `instanceCap` to 0 from MAX_INT. Otherwise requires a lot of logic to make it not be generated if set to the default of 0 from the config.jelly.
Added defaults for podRetention and workspaceVolume in PodTemplateStep.
Changed DynamicPVCWorkspaceVolume to be compliant with snippet generation, changed DataBoundConstructor to have no parameters, added DataBoundSetters for all properties.
Added tests classifier to workflow-cps test dependency to get the SnippitizerTest class.
Added unit test for PodTemplateStep.
[CPLT2-6206][JENKINS-57828] Accidentally left commented out code in a file.
Missed a brace that was in the comment.

timeline.bodyText: If you are not going to make a change, better to revert.
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: Did not mean to commit that commented code. I will remove it.
replies.author: kerogers-cloudbees

timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText: Since you did not patch PodTemplateStep/config.jelly, these constants are useless.
timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: Also the defaults look wrong. PodRetention.getPodTemplateDefault() is used for podRetention, and it might be significant that the default is left as null. Same for workspaceVolume and WorkspaceVolume getDefault(). I suspect that the config.jelly defaults were broken here, but this is just making it worse by extending the problem to the runtime.
replies.author: jglick

replies.bodyText:
Confirmed, the default selections in /pipeline-syntax/ are incorrect: they do not match the actual default behavior. The generator suggests
…, podRetention: always(), …, workspaceVolume: dynamicPVC(…), …
whereas the actual defaults (according to code inspection) are
…, podRetention: default(), …, workspaceVolume: emptyDirWorkspaceVolume(false), …
(Note that you cannot actually use the symbol default as in 
  
    
      kubernetes-plugin/src/main/java/org/csanchez/jenkins/plugins/kubernetes/pod/retention/Default.java
    
    
         Line 65
      in
      a54923a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           @Symbol("default") 
        
    
  

 as this is a keyword. Something else should have been chosen.)
So how does this happen?

The dropdown under Pod Retention defaults to Always just because that is first in the list and no default is specified. That is simply wrong.
The Workspace Volume configuration from #114 is not done in regular fashion. There should be no Use custom workspace volume checkbox.

It looks like #363 & #622 cleaned these things up in global pod template configuration but not in step configuration. Understandably: no one bothered to check the snippet generator, because it was so broken anyway.
replies.author: jglick
jglick

replies.bodyText:
So, as to a fix:

I think you should revert any changes to the behavior of getters (nullability annotations are fine). The configuration here is complicated due to the layering of per-step settings over (or under?) global settings, so nulls are significant in some cases. See null checks like: 
  
    
      kubernetes-plugin/src/main/java/org/csanchez/jenkins/plugins/kubernetes/pipeline/PodTemplateStepExecution.java
    
    
         Line 109
      in
      a54923a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           if (step.getWorkspaceVolume() != null) { 
        
    
  


The setter changes may be OK, though I am not sure. @Vlatombe would know if explicitly setting something to what ought to be its default value is actually required in order to override global settings.
The new defaultXXX fields need to use the actual defaults mentioned above.
The config.jelly needs to read those defaults, like PodTemplate/config.jelly already does.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.message: [CPLT2-6206] Changing PodTemplateStep to have a default value for instanceCap of Integer.MAX_VALUE. Adding logic to the setter that sets instanceCap to Integer.MAX_VALUE if the Integer passed to it is null  or less than equal to 0.
Merge branch 'master' into podTemplate-snippet-jenkins-57828-cplt2-6206
Fix merge
Merge branch 'master' into podTemplate-snippet-jenkins-57828-cplt2-6206

[CPLT2-6206] special case for inheritFrom to allow KubernetesPipelineTest.runInPodNestedExplicitInherit to pass. Having inheritFrom be null instead of an empty string was breaking something in the podTemplate construction.
[CPLT2-6206] Change the special string to ",default," as it doesn't require escaping in either xml or java and seems very unlikely to ever be the name of an actual template.

timeline.bodyText: Why this strange string? The commit comment says something about escaping in XML and Java but I do not see how that would be relevant. The value will only ever be used inside the snippet generator.
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText:
Simpler:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    if (inheritFrom != null && inheritFrom.equals(",default,")) { // Added to make KubernetesPipelineTest.runInPodNestedExplicitInherit() pass
          
          
            
                    if (",default,".equals(inheritFrom)) { // Added to make KubernetesPipelineTest.runInPodNestedExplicitInherit() pass
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.message: [CPLT2-6206]  Explain behavior of inheritFrom in the help text.

[CPLT2-6206] Changed the string to <noInherit> to reduce the confusion. The behavior I intended for this string to trigger is actually the opposite of the default behavior, it is to create a pod template step that has inheritance set to an empty string so that `PodTemplateStepExecution` will not add the templates to the inheritance.
[CPLT2-6206] restored empty string to be no inheritance and null to be default inheritance. Use the string "<default>" in the snippet generator to mean null in the generated script.
Merge branch 'master' into podTemplate-snippet-jenkins-57828-cplt2-6206
